moves.7... Qe7 8. Qc4: still early for exchanging queens and protecting the pawn in e4.
moves.10. Qxf7+: good move, to expose black king and prevent black castling.
moves.26. f4: to put the rock in action.
moves.27... Ngh5: attacking the rock and protecting the other knight.
moves.34. Rxg4: good one, to move the rock to f7 after Nxg4. !!!
moves.35... Kc8 36. Rxe7: very good, capture and attack in the same time. !!!
moves.36... Nf4 37. Re8+ Kb7: bad move, black king in the trap. ???
moves.38. Rb8#:
yes, in the mate trap. !!!
note: with some help from a pawn (b5) rock and knight are very powerful, a queen alone could not make the mate in this position.
conclusion : 1- my opponent is a good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes. 2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will appreciate what i have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing. 3- your advices, comments and votes will be appreciated with my thanks. 4- i like you all. 5- thank you. 6- a lot of thanks to GameKnot. friend of all Mustafa
